plugins.name: Token Lab
plugins.description:
Convert your Figma variables into Design Tokens, ready for consumption by Style Dictionary.


The plugin requires at least one variable to exist in the Figma document. With that present, pressing the "Export Variables" button will convert the variables table into JSON objects, in the following structure:


// collection-1.json

{

  "collection-1": {

    "my-variable": {

      "value": "#ffffff"

    }

  }

}


If variables are grouped the structure becomes:


// collection-1.json

{

  "collection-1": {

    "group-name": {

      "my-variable": {

        "value": "#ffffff"

      },

      "another-variable": {

        "value": "#000000"

      }

    }

  }

}


If modes are used, those are added like so:


// collection-1-mode-one.json

{

  "collection-1": {

    "group-name": {

      "my-variable": {

        "mode-one": {

          "value": "#ffffff"

        }

      }

    }

  }

}

// collection-1-mode-two.json

{

  "collection-1": {

    "group-name": {

      "my-variable": {

        "mode-two": {

          "value": "#000000"

        }

      }

    }

  }

}


If a description is added to a variable, it will be included as a comment:


// collection-1.json 

{

  "collection-1": {

    "my-variable": {

      "value": "#ffffff",

      "comment": "A Figma description"

    }

  }

}


This plugin has primarily been built and tested for one specific team, your mileage may vary.
plugins.tagline: Generate Design Tokens from Figma Variables

plugins.name: Movie data uploader
plugins.description:
Movie data uploader

Plugin for populating movie cards with data from a local data storage.

Image files from local must be named as follows:

E.g. "Avatar-2022"

(if the name of the movie is contained from multiple words separate them with space)

Naming elements inside a card element:

Element for image must have a element named "image"..

Element must have a text element named "title".

Element must have a text element named "year".

Elements selection:

One or more cards needs to be selected.

Select only card elements and not the parent element that contains card elements.

plugins.name: Zero Frame
plugins.description:
Deprecation Notice: Auto Layout V4 with Absolute Positioning covers most, if not all, of the use-cases of this plugin. I recommend using that instead. This plugin will exist as is to avoid disrupting workflows, but future updates are unlikely.


Easily create, convert or wrap layers in zero frames.


Add zero frame: Add a zero frame to selected frames and auto layouts, or if nothing is selected, the canvas.


Convert to zero frame: Convert selected frames and auto layouts to zero frames while retaining their positioning properties.


Wrap in zero frame: Wrap selected layers in a zero frame.


What and Why?

A zero frame is a frame with either zero height or zero width. It occupies no space on the canvas but can position layers within in.


Zero frames are often used to add layers to auto layouts with absolute positioning i.e. they are not affected by the stacking order of other layers in the auto layout. Some novel uses of zero frames are detailed in this great talk from Figma Config 2021 - Pushing Figma to its limits with Chudo, Andrei, Gleb, Vitalii, Shuaiqi.


Open Source

Zero Frame is open source and contributions are welcome.

accepted.name: Aashrey Sharma
accepted.description: Senior UX Designer @ Epic Games

plugins.tagline: Create, convert or wrap layers in zero frames

plugins.name: X-Sitemapper
plugins.description:
Transform your site planning process with the X-SiteMapper. Simply upload a CSV file, and watch as it automatically generates a clear, visual sitemap, perfect for planning and collaboration. Whether youâ€™re designing a new website, auditing existing structures, or planning user journeys, this tool makes it easy to visualise site architecture and communicate your vision. Save time, reduce errors, and improve collaboration with this intuitive and efficient plugin.


Before uploading your CSV file, please ensure it meets the following criteria:


1. The file should contain only a single column with all URLs listed.

2. The top entry must be the root/home URL.

3. There should be no empty rows in the column.

4. Each URL must be a full URL (e.g., https://example.com/category1/page1) rather than a relative path (e.g., /category1/page1).


Once your CSV file is correctly structured, upload it to X-SiteMapper, and it will generate the sitemap for you.

- Each sitemap level will be created in a separate frame.

- The tool supports up to 5 levels of sub-pages.

- The frames are able to be viewed as a prototype that can expand and collapse the different levels of pages by clicking the â€œ+â€ and â€œ-â€ icons displayed next to the page names.


If you have any questions please feel free to reach out to sitemapper@vml.com
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly create interactive sitemaps from CSV files in seconds

plugins.name: Based CDN
plugins.description:
Based CDN

basedcdn.com is a design to development asset pipeline. We make it possible for your design team to seamlessly make updates to assets in production without requiring development resources. We enable your team to make required design changes and publish these to a CDN. Once published you can share all of your asset URL's with development to use as the asset source.


How to Install

  1. Install on Figma plugin community
  2. Provide your email and namespace.
  3. Start publishing your assets.
  4. Share your BasedCDN URL's with your development team.


FAQ

What is BasedCDN?

  • BasedCDN is a design to development asset pipeline. We make it possible for your design team to seamlessly make updates to assets in production without requiring development resources. We enable your team to make required design changes and publish these to a CDN. Once published you can share all of your asset URL's with development to use as the asset source.

Why do you need my email?

  • We use your email as your internal ID and as a way to communicate with you.

What is a namespace?

  • The namespace is used as a unique resource identifier. This namespace will be used on all of your URL's in this format: https://static.basedcdn.com/<namespace>/asset.png

How much does this cost?

  • Free! ...up to the first 10,000 requests. After your account has reached 10,000 requests we will contact you on our pricing options.

How long does it take to update?

  • Assets will update instantly but in somecases up to 15 seconds. After an asset is updated we invalidate all versions of the previously cached asset.

What format is the asset in?

  • We support PNG and SVG assets

How do I install my assets on NPM?

  • An NPM install link is provided while viewing all of your assets.




For more information please visit basedcdn.com

plugins.name: Banana Test
plugins.description:
Test your interfaces to UX using "Banana-test" so easy!


Idea of plugin:

When you are testing the layout of some page where the user has to perform an action, try replacing all the texts with the word "Banana" or some nonsense like this. And then with this "sanitized" layout, you need to do corridor testing. And even if it is clear to all users what each interface element means, then this is a good interface! This means that you can easily connect other languages to your site, and even in case of a translation error in the interface text, the user will still be able to complete his task.

Of course, it makes no sense to conduct such tests on information blogs. But for some online store, this is quite a good way to check that the "Buy" button will be pressed, even if the fonts fall off.


Features:

This plugin can:

  • Replace all text in selected nodes to "Banana" or anything else
  • Clone selected nodes and replace text in this new nodes. It's more safely!


How to use?

  1. Run "Banana Test" plugin in Figma file.
  2. Select nodes, which you want to test.
  3. Click Banananizate ðŸŒ button.
  4. And "Voila!)" You have a lot of bananas!)


Contacts:

  • Email: me@jagk.ru
  • Plugin Homepage: Figma Community
  • Repository: GitHub
  • My GitHub: @jag-k

accepted.description: Full-stack developer

plugins.name: ASCII Punk
plugins.description:
Bring creativity to your designs with ASCII Punk! This Figma plugin transforms any image into fully customizable ASCII art, giving your visuals a unique and artistic edge. Whether you're experimenting with image effects or crafting standout designs, ASCII Punk is here to inspire.


Why Use ASCII Punk?


  1. Custom Backgrounds: Change the background color to complement your design.
  2. Adjustable Precision: Resize character size to get the perfect level of detail.
  3. Personalized Characters: Choose your own set of ASCII characters to make your art unique.
  4. Export Type: Choose to export ASCII effect as either an image or a group of nodes.


Designed for creative professionals and enthusiasts alike, ASCII Punk is a versatile tool for adding personality to your designs. Try it today and discover new ways to reimagine your images!


Important Note:

  1. For node based export, the time to export depends based on number of nodes.
  2. It is better to not have huge number of nodes for better performance


Feedback & Support:

I'd love to see what you've created using this plugin! Feel free to tag me or say hi on X/Twitter (@HarshithAshvi). Your feedback and bug reports are always welcome ðŸ™

plugins.name: upper-mask
plugins.description:
About

This is a plugin that performs clipping masks using shapes placed on top. It behaves similarly to the clipping mask function in Adobe Illustrator.


How to use

Right-click while selecting multiple objects and shapes that you want to mask.

Create a mask by selecting Plugins -> upper-mask from the context menu.


When used, a mask group is automatically created. The target shape is moved to the back of the group and becomes a mask mode.



-----

plugins.name: Peppercorn - Match Text Styles & Scales
plugins.description:
It allows you to seamlessly parse all your text styles and match them with a range of typography scales.

Key features include:

  1. Refine Your Current Typography Scale: Easily adjust and fine-tune your existing typography scale for improved visual harmony and readability in your designs.
  2. Adapt Typography for Different Devices: With Peppercorn, you can quickly find and apply a different typography scale for other devices by changing just one value, ensuring your design's responsiveness and versatility.

Additional Use Cases:

  1. Enhance Brand Consistency: Maintain a consistent typographic style across various design projects, reinforcing brand identity.
  2. Optimize User Experience: Utilize harmonious typography scales to improve user experience through clear, accessible text.
  3. Save Time in Design Process: Streamline your workflow by quickly comparing and applying typography scales, freeing up time for other creative tasks.
  4. Design Exploration: Experiment with different typography scales to discover new, impactful ways to present your content.



New: If you want to automatically generate a new type scale, very flexible, with documentation, variables & text styles, go check out my other plugin: https://www.figma.com/community/plugin/1324368566737768121/peppercorn-typography-scale-generator

plugins.name: Cult Translator
plugins.description:
With more than 180 languages, Cult Translator is a next-generation translator plugin for Figma designed to make your translations easy, fast, and precise. By allowing you to add context, this tool ensures that every translation reflects the true intent of your original design.


Context-Driven Accuracy:


Enhanced Reliability: Provide context such as â€œThis button triggers a payment processâ€ or â€œUsed in a formal corporate environment,â€ and the AI will deliver translations that capture the intended tone and meaning.


Clarifying Ambiguities: For example, if your design uses the term â€œpitch,â€ a context note like â€œreferring to a sales pitchâ€ prevents misinterpretation, ensuring the right word is chosen in the target language.


Localization:


Beyond just word-for-word translation, Cult Translator adapts your content to the cultural nuances of your target audience. This means that regional references (e. g. people's names, music genres, foods, dance styles, currency types, etc.) are adjusted so your message resonates naturally with local users.


Export for Review:


Keep track of every change! The plugin allows you to export a detailed log of all translations, enabling designers, translators, and reviewers to collaborate efficiently and ensure consistency across your projects.


How to Use:


  1. Select Elements: Choose text layers, groups, or frames in your design.


  1. Add Context: Enter any additional context in the dedicated field to guide the translation process.


  1. Choose Languages: Select your source and target languages using our intuitive, searchable dropdown menus.


  1. Translate & Localize: Click â€œTranslateâ€ for a context-enhanced conversion or â€œLocalizeâ€ for a culturally adapted version.


  1. Export Log: Easily export a review log of all translations for quality control and collaboration.


Works on Figma and FigJam:


Designed for both Figma and FigJam, Cult Translator works smoothly across platforms, making it perfect for design teams and collaborative environments.


Light & Dark Mode Support:


Enjoy a visually consistent experience regardless of your theme preference. CultTranslator is optimized for both light and dark modes.

plugins.name: VarVar
plugins.description:
VarVar is a Figma plugin that allows you to export your Figma variables to JSON, JS, CSV or CSS formats, making it easier to integrate your design tokens into your development workflow.


Features

  1. Export Figma variables to JSON, JS, CSV or CSS formats
  2. Identifies linked variables
  3. JSON: linked variables start with $.VARIABLE.PATH*
  4. JS: linked variables are referenced directly like collection.mode.variable (unquoted). Numeric paths are converted to bracket notation: collection.mode["500"]
  5. CSV: linked variables start with =VARIABLE/PATH*. CSV Option: â€œUse row & column positionsâ€. This will produce instead a "formula-like" (i.e. =E7) linking in spreadsheet programs.
  6. CSS: linked variables will call CSS function var(--VARIABLE). Variable in collections with one single mode will be put into :root{}, otherwise they will have their own class, i.e. .collection--mode{}
  7. Preview exported data within the plugin interface
  8. Automatically download exported files


*Note: When dealing with linked variables that have multiple modes, the plugin will only link to the first occurrence (i.e., the first mode it finds).


Usage

Design Mode

  1. Open your Figma file containing variables
  2. Run the VarVar plugin from the Plugins menu
  3. Choose your desired export format (JSON, JS, CSV or CSS)
  4. Click "Export Variables"
  5. The exported file will be automatically downloaded


Dev Mode

  1. Open your Figma file containing variables
  2. Switch to Dev Mode
  3. Run the VarVar plugin from the Plugins menu
  4. Choose your desired export format (JSON, JS, CSV or CSS)
  5. Click "Export Variables"
  6. The exported file will be automatically downloaded


Preview and Copy

Toggle the "Preview output" switch to see the exported data within the plugin interface

Use the "Select to Copy" button and copy (Ctrl/Command + C) the exported data to your clipboard. (Programmatically copying is currently not supported by Figma Plugin APIs).


VarVar is open source, consider contributing. Code available on GitHub.

Bug report, suggestions, etc. Open an issue.

113512.name: Rapid A/B Test
113512.description:
Streamline your design decision-making process with our lightning-fast voting plugin. In just a couple of minutes, collect more than 100 votes to compare two designs and make data-driven choices.


Try it out now using the playground file!


Key Features:

  1. Rapid feedback: Gather 100 votes in minutes
  2. Simple A/B testing: Compare two designs effortlessly


Usage:

  1. Select two frames that you want to compare
  2. Launch the plugin
  3. Set up the evaluation criteria, i.e., the question to the user
  4. Customize specific targeting (Impacts speed)
  5. Start survey
  6. Inspect results


Eliminate guesswork and boost team productivity. Make confident design decisions backed by real human preferences.


NOTE: The tool is free of charge and open to use while in development!
113512.tagline: Make quick data-driven design decisions based on real user feedback

plugins.name: Design System Radar
plugins.description:
Overview

Design System Radar is a specialized Figma plugin tailored for users of design system. This plugin enhances the user experience by providing robust tools for ensuring compliance with design system's standards, particularly focusing on spacing and style variables. It's an essential tool for designers who aim to maintain high levels of consistency and precision in their designs.


Features

  • Spacing Analysis: The plugin automatically identifies spacing discrepancies within selected frames, instances, and components. It compares these against design system's established spacing guidelines, flagging any non-conformities for review.
  • Style Variable Analysis: Design System Radar detects elements in your designs that are not bound to style variables. This feature is crucial for maintaining uniformity across your design projects.
  • Navigation for Quick Corrections: Users can quickly navigate to any elements that do not conform to design system directly from the plugin's interface, streamlining the design refinement process.


How to use?

Add [ds-radar]to the description of your main components so that they are detected by the "Instances" part of the plugin. And you can provide your own dimension system by entering values (in px) in the "Dimension" part of the plugin.

accepted.name: Martin Molcrette
accepted.description: UX/UI Designer

plugins.tagline: Design System compliance made easy with Design System Radar forÂ Figma

plugins.name: VectorMeasure Pro
plugins.description:
VectorMeasure Pro is an essential Figma plugin that simplifies the process of measuring the length of any type of vector within your design project. Whether it's lines, paths, or complex shapes, this plugin provides precise measurements with ease.

Key Features:

  1. Universal Vector Measurement: It supports all types of vectors in Figma, making it a versatile tool for designers working on various projects.
  2. Easy-to-Use Interface: The plugin boasts an intuitive and user-friendly interface, ensuring that designers of all levels can effortlessly utilize its measurement capabilities.
  3. Pixel-Perfect Accuracy: Get pixel-perfect measurements, ensuring your designs are always on point and in line with your vision.
  4. Efficient Workflow: Streamline your design workflow by eliminating the need for manual calculations or external measurement tools.
  5. Instant Results: Receive instant measurements without the hassle of switching between different tools or applications.
  6. Export and Share: Easily export measurement data or share it with your team, enhancing collaboration and design accuracy.

How It Works:

  1. Select the vector or vectors you want to measure within your Figma project.
  2. Launch the plugin from the Figma menu.
  3. Instantly receive precise measurements of your selected vectors in the units of your choice.
  4. Use the measurement data to fine-tune your designs and maintain consistency throughout your project.

The plugin is designed to save you time, boost accuracy, and enhance your overall Figma design experience. Say goodbye to the guesswork and manual calculations â€“ start measuring vectors effortlessly with VectorMeasure Pro!
plugins.tagline: Caluate the length of vector lines

plugins.name: FigLink
plugins.description:
Use FigLink to swap instances or any node with the same name or selected component.


If you are migrating from Sketch, First import all of your Sketch files, including library and other artboards, then publish components.

After publishing the components, run the "Collect Components" command from the plugin menu and wait for collecting.

Now go to each file in your team, run the "Link Instances to Library" command from the plugin menu and wait.


It looks for instances with the same name as your library components and replaces them with a new instance of the library component.


It preserves text overrides based on the position of text nodes.


Add "_" or "." to the starting of the component or page's name to skip collecting them. It also skips hidden nodes or nodes with a name starting with "_" or ".".

accepted.name: Saeed Alipoor
accepted.description:
A 3D Man, Dad, Dreamer, Devigner.
UXE figma.com/@thewall

plugins.tagline: Replace nodes with component instances and preserve changes

plugins.name: Sustainability UI checker by Sparck
plugins.description:
Sustainability UI checker is a Figma plugin that helps designers to create more energy-efficient UIs. It analyses each element of the UI and shows if its power consumption is low, moderate, or high. It also shows the cause of the high power consumption and possible solutions to reduce it.


How it works

  1. Each element of the UI it shows if the power consumption will be low, moderate or high. This will help designers to identify the elements of their UI that are most energy-intensive and make changes to improve their energy efficiency.
  2. It will show the cause of the modahigh power consumption. This will help designers to understand why certain elements of their UI are more energy-intensive than others.
  3. It will show possible solutions to reduce the power consumption. This will help designers to make changes to their UI that will reduce its energy consumption without sacrificing its usability or design.
  4. It will show the source of the information. This will allow designers to verify the accuracy of the information and to learn more about the factors that affect the power consumption of UI elements.



Here are some of the benefits of using Sustainability UI checker:

  1. Reduce the energy consumption of your UI. Sustainability UI checker can help you to identify the elements of your UI that are most energy-intensive and make changes to improve their energy efficiency. This can help to reduce the environmental impact of your website or application.
  2. Improve the performance of your UI. By reducing the power consumption of your UI, you can also improve its performance. This can make your UI more responsive and user-friendly.
  3. Save money. Reducing the energy consumption of your UI can save you money on your energy bills. This is especially beneficial for businesses with large websites or applications.


If you are a designer who is looking to create more energy-efficient UIs, then Sustainability UI checker is a great tool for you. It is easy to use and it can help you to make a real difference to the environmental impact of your work.
plugins.tagline: Audit UI elements energy efficiency with Figma sustainability checker plugin.

plugins.name: fts extractor
plugins.description:
Extract texts from your designs in a structured format as yaml or json.


This simple plugin is a complementary tool of flutter translator sheet.


Usage:


Just select any amount of elements on your canvas (Layers, Pages, Components), and select Plugins > fts extractor >

And choose one of the menu options.


It will generate a structured tree from the Strings found in the selection, based on the document's nodes hierarchy, so you can have a "cleaner" output if you name your layers properly.


The layers represents the field names in the yaml / json output. They are sanitized for illegal characters, spaces, and normalized in snake_case style.


Here's an example of the type of output you can get:


payment_details:
 card_details: Card Details
 mastercard:
  eden_hazard: Eden Hazard
  k_4754: '4754'
  k_3243: '3243'
  k_25000_aed: 25000 AED
 payment_details: ' Payment details'
 holder_name: Holder name
 card_number: Card number
 coupon_promo_code: coupon/ promo code
 m_m_yy: MM/YY
 cvv: CVV
 button_s_primary_default:
  confirm: Confirm



The idea is that you modify this file as needed to use as master template in fts cli.


So, power-up your Flutter development flow on internationalization, using flutter translator sheet, Figma and the fts extractor plugin.

accepted.name: Rodrigo LÃ³pez
accepted.description: flutter dev.

"This plugin assists you in applying specific font styles (i.e., Text Styles) in Chinese-English mixed typography, automatically inserting spaces between Chinese characters and half-width English letters, numbers, and symbols to ensure tidy and consistent formatting. Additionally, it supports the conversion of punctuation marks between full-width and half-width, further enhancing the professionalism and visual appeal of your text layout.

Usage Scenarios

If your design standards involve using different fonts for Chinese and English, you can try this plugin to adjust Chinese and English font styles separately for a text layer.

Function Description

Select Chinese and English fonts, and the plugin will automatically update the corresponding text layer's font styles.

Set spacing for Chinese-English mixed layout; the plugin automatically detects and adjusts the spacing between Chinese and English according to your settings.

Set the font family, weight, size, and line height, and establish the desired font styles as Figma Text Styles.

Notes

You need to set the required font styles as Figma Text Styles and then update them by selecting the target font styles.

plugins.name: Classic Resume - Markdown to Figma - md2fig
plugins.description:
This plugin is suited for job seekers, designers, and anyone wanting a beautiful resume layout crafted directly in Figma from Markdown.

md2fig GitHub for Comments/PRs

With the "Classic Resume" plugin, users can:

  1. Create a Resume from Markdown: Quickly convert Markdown text into a professionally designed resume, streamlining the layout process and allowing users to focus on content rather than design.
  2. Customizable Templates: Access a classic resume template that can be tailored to fit personal branding, font preferences, and color schemes within Figma.
  3. Real-time Editing: Make live adjustments to text, layout, and design elements directly in Figma, ensuring a visually consistent and polished result without exporting to external tools.
  4. Designed for Simplicity: Ideal for those with minimal design experience, the plugin simplifies resume creation with easy-to-use settings, giving a structured and classic look with minimal effort.


Flexible Export Options: Export resumes as high-quality PDFs or images straight from Figma, ready for job applications or portfolio showcases.
plugins.tagline: Instantly transform Markdown into a classic Figma resume. Copy and Paste an elegant resume

plugins.name: PonyUI Assets Export - Figma nodes to png, jpg, svg, svgr
plugins.description:
PonyUI Assets Export helps developers to export assets from Figma to local workspace! FAST and FREE!


âœ¨ Save your time - Configure what should be exported inside Figma with our Figma plugin and export all assets with a single command.


ðŸ“¤ Simplified asset export - No more repetitive steps for each file like save file to disk, rename and copy to source folder.


âš›ï¸ Automated React icons - Generate React icon components automatically, no more copy-pasting code to/from SVGR.


ðŸ’» Directly into your Local Workspace - our CLI tool will get all configured assets from your Figma file and save them in your source folder.


What you can do


  • You can export to png, jpg or svg files
  • You can set scale ratio for png & jpg assets
  • You can export any Figma node, doesn't matter what's inside. So you can compose different elements and export it as a single asset.
  • If you used SVGR to create React icon components from SVG files, PonyUI Assets Export will now do it for you.
  • Eslint and prettier supported for React icon components
  • PonyUI Assets Export will remember exported nodes, so you always know if a particular node is already exported in your source code and where to find it.
  • Inside the dev workspace you can configure different default folders for different types of assets.
  • And you can specify a custom folder for any special asset if you need it.


Usage


Inside the plugin


  • Open PonyUI Assets Export Plugin inside your Figma file.
  • Select a node you want to export in Figma and it appears in PonyUI Assets Export under the "Nodes" tab.
  • Under "Export as" combobox select any of png, jpg, svg or react-icon-component.
  • [Optional] It will fill File Name or Class Name text input automatically based on node's name, if you don't like the name, correct it.
  • [Optional] If you don't want it to be in a default path, please specify any relative path in your local workspace you want it to appear.
  • [Optional] For png & jpg assets if you want different scale than 2, set it.
  • Repeat steps 2-6 for each node you want to export.
  • Once done, open the "Publish" tab inside the Plugin and review changes you did.
  • Click "Save for Export" button and go to your local workspace.


In developer's local workspace


Install npm package & initialize it:


$ npm install --save-dev @ponyui/assets-export-cli
$ npx pa init


Import assets to your local workspace:


$ npx pa import



What's PonyUI


PonyUI is a toolchain aimed to automate the coding of your UI. It's going to be a small workhorse that converts Design to Code and vice versa to make Design File is the real "source of truth" for project's UI. Now we focus on a tool to convert Figma to React & React Native.


Our goal is to help software dev teams iterate faster and cheaper.
plugins.tagline: Batch export of assets right into dev workspace

plugins.name: code-transformer
plugins.description:
This is Proof of Concept of generating code from Figma using OpenAI API.

The plugin converts your Figma design into JSON format and call OpenAI API to generate code.


For the best outcome, structure your design


  • No Group, Just use Frame
  • Use Auto Layout as possible
  • define naming rule for Components and Variant properties
  • Use Style or/and TokenStudio
  • Structure layer like code
  • Name layers appropriately


This project is OSS and if you want to contribute or develop your own, please visit the repository below

https://github.com/kazuyaseki/figma-code-transformer

accepted.description: frontend dev. React, TS, Figma lover

plugins.name: Table Generator
plugins.description:
Instantly generate responsive tables with mock data to fit your design requirements.


Read Documentation | Watch Demo


Plugin Settings:

No. of Rows - Total number of rows required in the table.

Cell Width - Width of each cell in the table.

Cell Padding - Padding applied to each cell in the table.

Cell Alignment - Text alignment within each cell.

Striped Table - Option to enable zebra striping for the table.


Supported Data Types:


Blank Cell - Generates an empty cell.


Serial Number - Generates sequential numbers.

Ex: 1, 2, 3, ...


Name - Generates full names, providing options for first names, last names, and variations such as alphabetical order (A-Z), reverse alphabetical order (Z-A), and randomized sequences.

Ex: Alice Adams, Benjamin Brown, ...


Email - Generates email addresses with an option to provide custom domain names and variations such as alphabetical order (A-Z), reverse alphabetical order (Z-A), and randomized sequences.

Ex: alice.adams@example.com, benjamin.brown@somedomain.com, ...


List - Generates items from a list with variations such as alphabetical order (A-Z), reverse alphabetical order (Z-A), and randomized sequences.

Ex: Apple, Samsung, Google, ...


Date - Generates dates (randomized) with an option to pass custom year or year range (ex: 2004, 2004-2022) can be

Ex: 2024-06-22, 2024-Jun-22, ...


Date format tokens:

YYYY - Full year (e.g., 2024)

YY - Short year (e.g., 24)

MMM - Short month name (e.g., Jan)

MM - Month (e.g., 01 to 12)

DD - Day (e.g., 01 to 31)


Time - Generates times, randomized.

Ex: 13:45, 08:30 PM, ...


Time format tokens:

HH - Hours in 24-hour format (00 to 23)

hh - Hours in 12-hour format (01 to 12)

mm - Minutes (00 to 59)

ss - Seconds (00 to 59)

SSS - Milliseconds (000 to 999)

A - Period (AM or PM)


Timestamp - Generates timestamps, randomized.

Ex: 2024 Jun 21 08:39:16 AM, ...


Timestamp format tokens:

YYYY - Full year (e.g., 2024)

YY - Short year (e.g., 24)

MMM - Short month name (e.g., Jan)

MM - Month (e.g., 01 to 12)

DD - Day (e.g., 01 to 31)

HH - Hours in 24-hour format (00 to 23)

hh - Hours in 12-hour format (01 to 12)

mm - Minutes (00 to 59)

ss - Seconds (00 to 59)

SSS - Milliseconds (000 to 999)

A - Period (AM or PM)


Phone - Generates randomized phone numbers with customizable options including country code, phone number length, and starting digits.

Ex: +44 XXXXXXXXXX, ...


Number - Generates random numbers with options to specify maximum length and number range.

Ex: 1234566, 2344, ...


Price - Generates random prices within a specified range, allowing customization of currency prefix or suffix.

Ex: $ 200.00, 200.00 $, ...

YYYY - Full year (e.g., 2024)

YY - Short year (e.g., 24)

MMM - Short month name (e.g., Jan)

MM - Month (e.g., 01 to 12)

DD - Day (e.g., 01 to 31)


Time - Generates times, randomized.

Ex: 13:45, 08:30 PM, ...


Time format tokens:

HH - Hours in 24-hour format (00 to 23)

hh - Hours in 12-hour format (01 to 12)

mm - Minutes (00 to 59)

ss - Seconds (00 to 59)

SSS - Milliseconds (000 to 999)

A - Period (AM or PM)


Timestamp - Generates timestamps, randomized.

Ex: 2024 Jun 21 08:39:16 AM, ...


Timestamp format tokens:

YYYY - Full year (e.g., 2024)

YY - Short year (e.g., 24)

MMM - Short month name (e.g., Jan)

MM - Month (e.g., 01 to 12)

DD - Day (e.g., 01 to 31)

HH - Hours in 24-hour format (00 to 23)

hh - Hours in 12-hour format (01 to 12)

mm - Minutes (00 to 59)

ss - Seconds (00 to 59)

SSS - Milliseconds (000 to 999)

A - Period (AM or PM)


Phone - Generates randomized phone numbers with customizable options including country code, phone number length, and starting digits.

Ex: +44 XXXXXXXXXX, ...


Number - Generates random numbers with options to specify maximum length and number range.

Ex: 1234566, 2344, ...


Price - Generates random prices within a specified range, allowing customization of currency prefix or suffix.

Ex: $ 200.00, 200.00 $, ...
93312.release_notes: Bug fixes on random number range generation logic
93312.tagline: Effortlessly generate tables with mock data.

plugins.name: Bytesim
plugins.description:
Use this plugin to sync your design with the Bytesim website.


ByteSim is a web application that simulates the ecological footprint of a website. From the import of a website mockup and the description of its content, ByteSim will create recommendations to reduce its ecological footprint.


This project was developed by the Media Engineering Institute (MEI) of the HEIG-VD with the support of Romande Ã‰nergie.
